answers.answer: Just a guess. Have you been checked for diabetes?  Those are some of the symptoms I experience when my blood glucose is low...Good luck.
I had blood tests years ago but I didnt have to fast for them.
If you drink diet sodas, STOP.  They contain Aspartame.  If you chew gum STOP!  They contain Aspartame - except for Bubble yum.
I don't have any of that anyway :/

Good for you.   I have been reading/hearing so much about Aspartame lately that I am frankly scared of it.A slow thyroid can cause fatigue, but so can Fibromyalgia and a tumor on the Parathyroid.   Did your blood work show a deficiency of D3 or B 12?   Both of these vitamins are needed for  good health.The fact that you are fainting leads one to believe there is a vascular problem.   You might have low blood pressure.Please let us know what the doctor says...

Thanks for the tips, went to doctor yesterday and said isn't any obvious things he can think of because doesn't follow a pattern and from the hot sweats I have with it so I am having fasting blood tests to see if any of the wiser
Girl, you're too young to have hot flashes!  You might need to see a gyn to see if your ovaries are okay.   Sounds like hormones are out of whack.
Just had blood results back and all I know is that all have come back normal except vitamin D and my full blood count and got another appointment on Monday to find out more
Turns out I have glandular fever and vitamin d of 18 tho doc doesn't think this is all that's causing me to feel the way I do as been feeling like this since december

question: I have been feeling very fatigue ATM, I know I have a physical job but have never felt physically tiered like this all the time. Since December 2013 at least once a week I have been experiencing hot sweats with dizziness, I find if I take some clothing off and sit/lie down after about 15mins - 30mis the symptoms pass but if I try and push myself to carry on with what I'm doing I then get ringing in the ears, blurred vision and eventually black out which has happened twice. I can't seem to find a pattern to when this happens as comes out of the blue. Does anyone know what this could be?
title: Dizziness, fatigue, hot flashes
